title: Gold Spitting Jew
description: A controversial painting created by Czech artist Ondřej Zábranský, depicting antisemitic imagery. The work employs traditional painting techniques to propagate hateful stereotypes and conspiracy theories targeting Jewish people. This piece exemplifies how art can be weaponized to spread extremist ideologies.
artistBio: Ondřej Zábranský is a Czech artist associated with neo-Nazi and far-right extremist movements. His works frequently promote white supremacist ideology, antisemitism, and historical revisionism. He has been convicted multiple times in the Czech Republic for promoting movements aimed at suppressing human rights and freedoms.
historicalContext: This work was created during a period of rising far-right extremism and hate speech in parts of Europe. It represents the continuation of antisemitic visual propaganda that has historically been used to dehumanize Jewish people and incite violence. Such imagery echoes hateful tropes dating back centuries, including those employed during the Holocaust.
technique: The painting employs traditional oil painting techniques and figurative representation, demonstrating how conventional artistic methods can be subverted to serve hateful purposes. The technical execution is overshadowed by the deeply problematic and dangerous ideological content.
